detailsOfAchievement: The slum based Children Development Program provided opportunities for refined behaviour, Social interaction and mental development to 125 children every year. This programme feeds, ensures medical care and dresses the children neatly. Education Empowerment Programme: To help underprivileged children in terms of educational opportunities PAT has been providing Special Coaching in Tamil, English and Maths benefiting 600 students per year. Tailoring Centres: With the purpose of providing employment opportunities PAT has been providing tailoring skills to adolescent school girls and jobless young women benefited two hundred and four. Computer Training: PATs Computer centres aim at helping students to compete with their urban counterparts for IT related jobs. These centres benefited 252 students. Health Care Programme: In collaboration with the Lions club, the Aravind eye hospital and District Blindness Eradication Society, PAT conducted three eye camps which benefited 553 persons. Organic Farming: In harmony with its committed to create healthy environment, PAT encourages the farmers to produce safe to eat food free of pollutions hazardous to health. In this direction, PAT helps the farmers by producing natural fertilizers to replace chemical fertilizer combinations that harm the soil. PAT has set up demonstration and production plants of vermi compost to ensure crop productivity and restoration of soil heath, destroyed by indiscriminate use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides. Clean Energy Programme: PAT is committed to conservations of natural resources in the context of global warming and climate change. PAT encourages its clients to use energy efficient consumer durables like the improved cook stove and the solar lamps. Financial Inclusion through Micro Finance a little bit of encouragement, necessary skills and just minimal financial assistance is all that the poorest of the poor needs to turn into thriving small business entrepreneurs. The availability of loans increases their confidence and motivation. Microfinance and Women Empowerment: Women interacting with other women in the group and the resource persons collaborating with the group, acquire knowledge, information, and motivation, besides leadership abilities. Awareness of rights and privileges of women, value of the girl child, need of education, awareness on health, hygiene and environmental concerns are other fall out women gathering in Self Help groups.

detailsOfAchievement: Peopleâ€™s craft Training Centre founded in 1991 working with deprived sections of the society/People with disability/women and children. We have formed 800 women self-help groups and developed Panchayat level federation and made them self-reliant. In Thurinchapuram Block of Tiruvannamalai District developed a rehabilitation program for 2700 people with disability. As part of this program A day care centre, an early Intervention center for the children with disability, vocational training centre for People with disability and community intervention adult people with disability. Educating the community members on Clean India and construction of House hold Toilets, promotion of organic farming and Kitchen garden. We have our own rehabilitation workshop to support people with disability for their mobility and seating devices. Climate change awareness is being created and promote plastic free villages and Tree plantation. We work in close collaboration with the District Administration of Tiruvannamalai for all the above programs. A software for the maintenance of the database of PWDs has been developed by us and given to the District Administration .

detailsOfAchievement: Trains young learners in Bharanatyam and carnatic vocal and instrumental under its Natya and Sangeeta Shalas.Has over hundred students.Done five arangetrams and over ten salangai poojais.Value added training through teaching of theory and history of dance and music, folk arts, traditional temple ritual music of tevaram, tiruvasagam and tirupugaz.Periodical heritage camps at various temple sites of artistic significance is organized for students. Has produced and staged research based dance and music programmes involving the gurus and learners.Experimental and innovative methodology are introduced to develop creativity in students.Had presented a natya natakam based on Silappadikaram at the World Tamil Conference. Presented Sri Valli at Melattur Bhagavatamela festival. Presented Vande Mahatma as part of the Gandhi foundation celebrations on Gandhi jayanti. Presented Mihira based on Varahamihira astrological work for International Dance alliance. Presenting over fifty children in a natya natakam Sri Ramayanam where music students sing and dance students perform. Students are given platform for interdisciplinary research in academic fields of physics and dance maths and music. A library of books, DVDs and other multimedia archives is being created for student use. Conducts an annual dance seminar called TSParthasarathy memorial dance seminar. Invites senior artistes and scholars to impart training through lectures and workshops. Recently Dr Kudavayil Balasunramaniam gave a lecture on Tanjavur temple. Takes students for margazi uncavritti around the Kapaliswara temple as part of heritage preservation. Every student of dance is taught music, yoga, theory of dance along with epic stories to add dimensions to learning process. Music students are encouraged to give small concerts and are also encouraged to understand nuances of singing for dance. The institution strives at giving holistic training for students in our Indian art forms.
